body:
@dragotin @danimo thx


von samsung mobile gesendet

same as #1167 i submit in own cloud/mirall

my server is also running linux / simplehosting with gandi.net
my desktop client is osx 1.4.2

i think gandi made some modifications on simplehosting, but i'm unable to know what.

i you need to try, i have created a user for you :

server : https://owncloud.whirlsoft.com 
login : test
password : test

i can confirm with your server too. i get the "invalid content-length in
response" when trying to sync with my desktop client. checking the response
headers when downloading via the web also shows two "content-length"
headers.

is this somehow related to gandi having varnish on the frontend?


on tue, nov 19, 2013 at 8:25 am, duts <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> same as #1167 <https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/1167> i submit in
> own cloud/mirall
>
> my server is also running linux / simplehosting with gandi.net
> my desktop client is osx 1.4.2
>
> i think gandi made some modifications on simplehosting, but i'm unable to
> know what.
>
> i you need to try, i have created a user for you :
>
> server : https://owncloud.whirlsoft.com
> login : test
> password : test
>
> â€”
> reply to this email directly or view it on github<https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5933#issuecomment-28789303>
> .
>

i don't know.. varnish has always being running.
i ask gandi to know if they made some modifications. waiting for answer.

however, i'm sure that a developer could debug the desktop client side. all other access are fine (webdav, caldav, carddav...)

@uranther  
also there is this message in apache error log :

[tue nov 19 15:23:11.179084 2013] [core:crit] [pid 4436:tid 3329474344704] (13)permission denied: [client 172.17.1.127:39758] ah00529: /srv/data/web/vhosts/owncloud.dutour.fr/htdocs/data/.htaccess pcfg_openfile: unable to check htaccess file, ensure it is readable and that '/srv/data/web/vhosts/owncloud.dutour.fr/htdocs/data/' is executable

got you the same message ?

@duts i have that message but not since monday around when i was installing
it. i tried changing the /owncloud/data/ directory to 771 permissions (o+x)
but it's changed back to 770 - probably because owncloud sets it. the
.htaccess file in that directory has read permissions: 664.

i don't think that message is related to the content-length issue.


on tue, nov 19, 2013 at 1:20 pm, duts <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @uranther <https://github.com/uranther>
>
> also there is this message in apache error log :
>
> [tue nov 19 15:23:11.179084 2013] [core:crit] pid 4436:tid 3329474344704<http://13>permission
> denied: [client 172.17.1.127:39758] ah00529: /srv/data/web/vhosts/
> owncloud.dutour.fr/htdocs/data/.htaccess pcfg_openfile: unable to check
> htaccess file, ensure it is readable and that '/srv/data/web/vhosts/
> owncloud.dutour.fr/htdocs/data/' is executable
>
> got you the same message ?
>
> â€”
> reply to this email directly or view it on github<https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5933#issuecomment-28817388>
> .
>

yes it seems that owncloud resets systematically the permissions of /data and /data/.htaccess to 770 
then apache claims "unable to check htaccess file, ensure it is readable ..."
not sure that bug is related to our problem.

i have a contact with gandi support : they are testing with the account i made.

the duplicate content-length header is a know varnish bug 
https://www.varnish-cache.org/trac/ticket/801
https://www.varnish-cache.org/trac/ticket/1272
(any many more http://bit.ly/17lmnpq)

i'm closing this as it's not an issue within owncloud - thx

@deepdiver1975 
yes... but, it is very difficult to find a solution if you can't help us.

gandi, who had varnish implemented for all instance of their "simple hosting" offer, indicate to add a header to deactivate the cache system :
header ("cache-control: max-age=1");

could you tell me where i should patch owncloud and add that instruction ?

i hope you have a little time for an answer.
thank you much.

> could you tell me where i should patch owncloud and add that instruction ?

you have these issues only while syncing - right?

hi, i have exactly the same problem for few days. i had a simple hosting in gandi and i can't sync with the owncloud client (windows or linux). error : invalid content-length in response
i try to reinstall owncloud server but nothing change.
the issue is only while syncing.
yes. anything else works perfectly (carddav, caldav, webdav).
guys, we need a wireshark trace and a client log (http://doc.owncloud.org/desktop/1.4/troubleshooting.html) to see what's going on.

ok, i'll send you a new one (you can also read the log in the case  #1167 i submit in own cloud/mirall ).

you can also try a sync on my current server :
https://owncloud.whirlsoft.com
user : test
login : test
